item.title: About Me
item.description: I am a student of IIT Roorkee studing Electrical Engineering and have been developing games for over 2 years. In some ways I was always interested in computer graphics and visual effects, which developed into a passion for creating games. I started my journey in game development using Android Studio making my first game Tic-tac-toe using the various components provided in it. I worked on various android apps, but soon realized that my passion lies in game development, after I started working on Blockks in my summers.

item.description: PRIVACY POLICY MODEL FOR MOBILE APPLICATIONS This privacy policy governs your use of the software application Splitter (“Application”) for mobile devices that was created by Mobile Development Group. The Application is a game where the players have to use touch controls to avoid falling obstacles. The game also has a leaderboard What information does the Application obtain and how is it used? item.title: Projects
item.description: Splitter (Unity3D) Splitter is simple 2D mobile game available for Android made using Unity3D engine. Worked on powerup system to make the game fun and challenging Worked on optimization of game to run smoothly on low end phones Worked on reducing size of the game Secured 1st prize in Game development competition of Shristi(Techno-Hobby Exhibition, IIT Roorkee) Citadel (Android Studio) Citadel is an Android app for efficient and smooth sharing of books in college campus, promoting a healthy reading culture.
